embeds.title: Bauble Burst
embeds.description:
Rare Attack / 2 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Deal 10 damage.
Perform 3 times:
[ **Socket** ] ( [ **Socket** ])

messages.content: it triple procs
yeah that
:sencheese:
probably that twin slam can natively infinite
if you have empty draw the second slam redraws twin slam

Because it's 1 cost instead of 2, so if you draw it mid-turn you are more likely to have the energy to play it. Also you can use the second slam to draw the initial twin slam for the infinite if you play that way.

Honestly I don't take bauble burst often. It takes too long to go online. It is extremely cost inefficient so it NEEDS gems to function. Twin slam is early damage. Not great damage, but damage and sometimes that's what you need.
twin slam + earlygame sapphire is a great combo
helps out on nob and lavag (since defensive mode isnt affected by -dex)

My thought process on bauble burst is thar unless it is upgraded and has 2 gems in it, it's just not good at all. When you pick it up unupgraded you need to visit a campfire to upgrade it then a second to socket the 2nd gem, and you also need to have a good gem to socket into it. If you have a good gem that you want to socket already then you may have to wait half an act to actually get it into BB, and if you don't have a good gem already you may wait that long and still have nothing to show for it. And yes it's pretty good once you do have it online, but proccing 6 gems for 2 energy and 1 draw isn't as good as proccing 3 gems for 0 energy and draw neutral (exploit gems)
Very glad I am posting paragraphs about Bauble burst on a collector relic discussion lol
most ontopic daily discussion
Also cards with sockets are already good enough scaling I've found, so BB isn't really necessary.
i often pick bauble burst
just to do the funny <shiv gem> and <ward gem> combo

messages.content: Time eater would like to know your location
I have never seen The Contract before in my life.
honestly as much as I dislike time eater, I dislike not having it more. Card spam is just so prevalent in its absence.
character specific shop relics do be like that sometimes.
Time to play villains in standard mode more—
do you think there would be better ways to disincentivize card spamming?
remove watcher 3's empty fist
back to the topic of collecotr

No?
mentioned once
i think that was immediately shut down by michael

I think having multiple bosses that soft counter it (around the same amount as watcher 3) in different ways, I'd possibly want to see silent 2 reworked to have temp spikes under certain conditions than the clone, because it's a 50/50 if your moves work which is frustrating.

Yeah, Silent 2 isn't the most difficult, just incredibly tedius if your luck is bad. That, and Silent 2 technically REWARDS card spam. People who make 10 small attacks every turn aren't at all affected by the clone, whereas people who make 2 or 3 large attacks every turn may lose like half (if not more) of their damage through no fault of their own.
silent 2 punishes single big attacks and non-attack single target damage

I've said this before, but downfall bosses as a whole don't do a lot of things base game bosses do, so some things are just really bad, and do some things more making some mechanics overcentralizing.

Character bosses debuff you less, multihit more often, almost never have any status infliction (outside of 2 notable exceptions in act 1), and block for much more per turn. This means that stuff like orange pellets and artifact are less viable (excluding characters that interact with self-debuffs), -strength is excessively strong and works really well versus many many bosses, and stuff like medkit are less effective vs. bosses.
~~silent 2 punishes not memorizing the speed of her idle animation and matching it up with the real one next turn~~
~~yes this is a thing~~
lmao
…So it's either a 50/50 or it has literally no effect, depending on how good your eyes are.
i choose not to do that because it's cheesy lol but i used to because it was funny that it worked

I know it's a different campaign so it will ultimately have a different meta, but it is a lot less balanced than base game's, and these are just some mechanics I see that are used way too much or way too little, so the counterplay for them is either less useful or more useful because of that.

I feel like this is more an unfortunate consequence of how basegame cards work
that said, giving character bosses more beam cells, uppercuts, and wide opens would be one way to fix the debuff problem

embeds.title: Shame
embeds.description: Pleading Vagrant Weekly Patch 38: Bane Adding curse card Shame.

messages.content: Give some boss like "whenever *boss* applies weak or vuln, they sldo apply frail" as the neow power thingy

Kind of a strange relic. It's just somewhat rare that I've found myself in a situation where I don't have enough essence to take the cards that I want for my collection. This is offering you an exchange between two currencies, but I think that souls are by and large the more valuable currency, and since you have to be at a shop to see this, there is a massive opportunity cost to using them to buy this relic, and therefore souls. I could remove a card, buy one of the other 2 relics, purchase a potion, or buy a key card that will help my deck in the upcoming fights. Against those options, getting some additional essence so that I can more comfortably speculate on taking collected cards just doesn't feel very attractive. I could see taking it if you knew that several of the upcoming pool of elite/hallway fights had collected cards you really wanted, but you would still need to be very low on essence for this to be worth it. Keep in mind that you can always take the act bosses collected card, since you receive 3 essence for defeating them.

On the boss subject: A hermit version that uses its debuff package but redirects all the debuffs onto you would be pretty straightforward. Repeated weak and frail, and one time Vulnerable 2 from Gestalt. Also, reworking the summons from Mushroom Ironclad so they inflict Slimed status would be very easy.
that still leaves things pretty unbalanced though

I feel pretty much the same as Kiku about this relic. During my climb to A20, I don't think I was ever tempted to buy this. While I occasionally can't pick up a collectible I'd like to, it's not a big enough issue to make me want to spend souls on this.
the whole point of essence is too make early game more nuanced in what you take to kill your first elites
collector without essence is just braindead, you aren't punished by taking any collected card ever because of how much manipulation you have over the pile

This relic is awful and pointless and I would never buy it. I skip collectibles pretty judiciously in order to keep the collection deck efficient. I often have a big surplus of essence at the end of the run. Occasionally I am a little lower on essence and skip a card I slightly want to have taken, but never to the extent that I wish I had paid 150 souls to do so.

If this were at least a normal found relic, it might _sometimes_ have any kind of effect - it would probably still be The Boot tier - but to buy it from a shop? Hardly.
I wouldn't say it is always like that exactly because of cards like darklings where you want as many of them as possible, or sentries.

This isn't just low ascension greed by the way, I cruised to A20 pretty easily on collector. Maybe once Soulforge doesn't exist in its current form there might be _some_ more incentive to have a sloppier, less choosy collection?
Worth nothing.
And maybe you've been especially event hungry because of serpents head.
Since it's based on doing combats.
If the extra essence from elites and bosses was removed, this would probably be worth buying.
Especially since the bosses have very strong cards attached.

this card lets you take 3 more collectables, its one of 2 ways you can get a large chunk of essence (the other being the rare card that gives 9). 150 gold for what is essentially 3 cards you can choose is a steal, but you have to find those cards first and you have to acutally be low on essence to need more. Its a super swingy relic for those reasons, sometimes this relic is incredible and makes your deck way stronger but other times its a dud since you already have enough essence to take the cards you want anyways. Its pretty fitting that this is a shop relic since those tend to be very situational.

currently, thanks to Omen and cards that help you draw from your collected pile having decks that just slam down dozens of collected cards quickly are very very powerful. But like all of the cards that make that plan good are scheduled to be nerfed so we will see how long that lasts.

I currently do like seeing this relic more often then I dont though, but I also think that Omen is collecters best card (and that darklings is the best collectable card) so that might have something to do with it.
they've made custom cards before (fungus among us for IC2) so clearly it's possible. As long as it still fits the character I think it would be fine.
so, similar to what Defect 1 does with the void? Honestly that's kinda cool, I like that idea. As for the mushrooms, yeah I like that one too.
ok that actually sounds cool
problem is that I don't think hermit has any self-frail cards anymore
<desperado>

embeds.title: Desperado
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Deal 10 (12) damage.
Double this card's damage this combat. It costs 1 more.

messages.content:
I would actually argue that this shouldn't be a shop relic. A reasonable number of shop relics fit into 3 categories. Relics that could be total blanks or even a negative in the wrong deck (chem X, prismatic shard, brimstone,  strange spoon, abacus), relics that could impact gameplay/decision making in a way that isn't fun for some players which means that picking them up as regular drops could negatively impact a players enjoyment of the run (Frozen eye is a big one here, toolbox), relics that involve making decisions on pickup (cauldron, orrery, dolly's mirror). To be fair, there are also plenty of relics that don't fit that mold, including clockwork souvenir, orange pellets, hand drill (just terrible all around), lee's waffle (the full heal on pickup sort of puts it into the third category), medkit, membership card, sling of courage, twisted funnel, runic capacitor, and melange. 

The contract is very rarely beneficial, since it's fairly common to have a surplus of essence, and be very picky about what you are adding to a well curated collected pile. Buying it from a shop is just such a strange decision to make when you consider how many other, much more immediate options you have to spend your souls on instead. I feel like getting this as a normal drop instead would make more sense, since then you can immediately spend the souls on something if you want (the collected reward from that combat), and because it could give your more of an incentive to build a very large collected pile and pursue a different style of deck in that run. Maybe what the contract is missing is some incentive to spend all these extra souls and fill your deck up with collected cards. What if it pre-upgraded collected cards in some way, like an egg relic?
~~insert comment about how downfall makes hand drill good~~

the majority of shop relics still fit into the catagory of being very good situationally or are just weird. Relics like Frozen eye, brimstone. strange spoon and chemical X can be game changing in the right decks, but can also be a complete dud or even detrimental. The others are just relics that wouldn't really fit as normal drops like Cauldron and prismatic shard and are just put into the shop to have someplace to be.

contract would be a relic that wouldn't be particularly useful to find from a random elite, since its value is mostly based on how much essence you already have and that fluctuates throughout the whole run.
really the only place were contract can have any value to the player is if its in the shop, since if you don't want essence you don't have to buy it.
nah what truly makes hand drill good is hierophant and unchained
lol unchained in downfall is so strong. Silent 2 goes byebye.
Hmm, for some reason I thought I remembered Hole Up giving frail but I guess it gives weak instead. If there's no frail in his card pool anymore that would be annoying
I guess you could just stick one or two copies of Shame in his deck, but that only gives 1 turn of the effect

what a shame
without that it's hard to justify giving any of the bosses a way to inflict frail except via Shame

desperado used to be reverse <hole up>. High damage, frail.
